[Face palm]

Wait, [@Beale](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/70533-beale/), this place is in the middle of the ocean! That's crazy and awesome, but I thought it was going to be near (or on) that South-west island.

> 
> 
> 43 minutes ago, DMSP said:
> 
> 
> Wait, [@Beale](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/70533-beale/), this place is in the middle of the ocean! That's crazy and awesome, but I thought it was going to be near (or on) that South-west island.
> 

Good point, I should change the name.

Building on land became impractical because:

- Folks play on different terrain settings.

- I think terrain scatter is somewhat random and may appear inside the buildings occasionally (?)

It is *near* the southwest island, maybe 50km from the coast.

[Here you go.](https://www.dropbox.com/s/68qub68zqfw0wmx/Modding%20Mun.7z?dl=0)

I recommend also to install Wings3D.

Inside you will find directories for [Black\_Site] and [Mun\_Launch\_A].

Black\_Site contains the files you are looking for, Mun\_Launch\_A Contains some static meshes for a Moon base.

![77f5c3ee26.jpg](http://puu.sh/p1qqN/77f5c3ee26.jpg)

Wow!

Like you say, the textures *are* stretched, but I really like your model ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") 

Nice design.

And "Bealekor Kosmocentre" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") 

My only advice is to construct everything in Unity, as objects placed with KK will tend to not be positioned exactly the same place when you reload the save - floating point accuracy issue.

> Quote

> My only advice is to construct everything in Unity, as objects placed with KK will tend to not be positioned exactly the same place when you reload the save - floating point accuracy issue.

Yeah, that's the only problem I've been having...

You see, if I make the object too big/elaborate, Unity throws a fit and crashes when I try to export it. What you saw in the pictures (minus the building I made) had to be exported in three pieces.

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, Third\_OfFive said:
> 
> 
> Yeah, that's the only problem I've been having...

> You see, if I make the object too big/elaborate, Unity throws a fit and crashes when I try to export it. What you saw in the pictures (minus the building I made) had to be exported in three pieces.

Do you have a picture of your Unity hierarchy + What version you are using?

I am putting together SWLS in Unity 5 (5.2 I think?), it is very complex now, but no problems so far.

Each mesh is a child of the root object, each mesh has its own collider module.

![d998bd2387.jpg](http://puu.sh/psXLj/d998bd2387.jpg)
